# Best selling platform
# Grouping the sales values by platform, summing all values and sorting in descending order
df_best_selling_platform = raw_data[['Platform', 'Global_Sales']].groupby(by=['Platform'], as_index=False).sum().sort_values(['Global_Sales'], ascending=False)

plt.figure(figsize=(20, 8))
plt.bar(df_best_selling_platform['Platform'], df_best_selling_platform['Global_Sales'], color='midnightblue')
plt.title("Global sales by each platform", fontsize=16, fontweight='bold', loc='left')
plt.xlabel('Platform', fontsize=14)
plt.ylabel('Revenue [in millions of USD]', fontsize=14)
plt.show()

# Best selling genre
# Grouping the sales values of all regions by genre, summing all values and sorting in descending order
df_best_selling_genre = raw_data[['Genre', 'NA_Sales', 'EU_Sales', 'JP_Sales', 'Other_Sales', 'Global_Sales']].groupby(by=['Genre'], as_index=False).sum().sort_values(['Global_Sales'], ascending=False)

# Stacked bar plot
# The bottom argument are the coordinates that the bar should start plotting. Without it, they will be plotted all starting at zero, and will hide each others values.
plt.figure(figsize=(20, 8))
plt.bar(df_best_selling_genre['Genre'], df_best_selling_genre['NA_Sales'], color='midnightblue')
plt.bar(df_best_selling_genre['Genre'], df_best_selling_genre['EU_Sales'], color='darkorange', bottom=df_best_selling_genre['NA_Sales'])
plt.bar(df_best_selling_genre['Genre'], df_best_selling_genre['JP_Sales'], color='firebrick', bottom=df_best_selling_genre['NA_Sales']+df_best_selling_genre['EU_Sales'])
plt.bar(df_best_selling_genre['Genre'], df_best_selling_genre['Other_Sales'], color='forestgreen', bottom=df_best_selling_genre['NA_Sales']+df_best_selling_genre['EU_Sales']+df_best_selling_genre['JP_Sales'])

plt.title("Global sales of genre divided by regions", fontsize=16, fontweight='bold', loc='left')
plt.xlabel('Genre', fontsize=14, fontweight='bold')
plt.ylabel('Revenue [in millions of USD]', fontsize=14, fontweight='bold')
plt.legend(['North America sales', 'Europe sales', 'Japan sales', 'Other regions sales'], frameon=False)
plt.show()

# Publisher's sales by region
df_publishers_market_share = raw_data[['Publisher', 'NA_Sales', 'EU_Sales', 'JP_Sales', 'Other_Sales', 'Global_Sales']].groupby(by=['Publisher'], as_index=False).sum().sort_values(['Global_Sales'], ascending=False)
# Top 20 publishers in market share
df_publishers_market_share = df_publishers_market_share.head(20)

# Calculating the percentage of market revenue for each region
for column in ['NA_Sales', 'EU_Sales', 'JP_Sales', 'Other_Sales']:
    df_publishers_market_share[column] = df_publishers_market_share[column]/df_publishers_market_share['Global_Sales']*100
    
# Stacked bar plot
# The bottom argument are the coordinates that the bar should start plotting. Without it, they will be plotted all starting at zero, and will hide each others values.
plt.figure(figsize=(20, 10))
plt.barh(df_publishers_market_share['Publisher'], df_publishers_market_share['NA_Sales'], color='midnightblue')
plt.barh(df_publishers_market_share['Publisher'], df_publishers_market_share['EU_Sales'], color='darkorange', left=df_publishers_market_share['NA_Sales'])
plt.barh(df_publishers_market_share['Publisher'], df_publishers_market_share['JP_Sales'], color='firebrick', left=df_publishers_market_share['NA_Sales']+df_publishers_market_share['EU_Sales'])
plt.barh(df_publishers_market_share['Publisher'], df_publishers_market_share['Other_Sales'], color='forestgreen', left=df_publishers_market_share['NA_Sales']+df_publishers_market_share['EU_Sales']+df_publishers_market_share['JP_Sales'])

plt.title("Global sales of genre divided by regions", fontsize=16, fontweight='bold', loc='left')
plt.xlabel('Percentage of Sales [%]', fontsize=14, fontweight='bold')
plt.ylabel('Publisher', fontsize=14, fontweight='bold')
plt.legend(['North America sales', 'Europe sales', 'Japan sales', 'Other regions sales'], frameon=False, ncol=4, loc='upper right')
plt.show()

This dataset contains a list of video games with sales greater than 100,000 copies. It was generated by a scrape of vgchartz.com.

Fields include

* Rank - Ranking of overall sales
* Name - The games name
* Platform - Platform of the games release (i.e. PC,PS4, etc.)
* Year - Year of the game's release
* Genre - Genre of the game
* Publisher - Publisher of the game
* NA_Sales - Sales in North America (in millions)
* EU_Sales - Sales in Europe (in millions)
* JP_Sales - Sales in Japan (in millions)
* Other_Sales - Sales in the rest of the world (in millions)
* Global_Sales - Total worldwide sales.
